metadata.title: CVE-2017-5967 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The time subsystem in the Linux kernel through 4.9.9, whenCONFIG_TIMER_STATS is enabled, allows local users to discover real PIDvalues (as distinguished from PID values inside a PID namespace) by readingthe /proc/timer_list file, related to the print_timer function inkernel/time/timer_list.c and the __timer_stats_timer_set_start_infofunction in kernel/time/timer.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5967` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-lowlatency - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-208-lowlatency - 4.4.0-208.240
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1150-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1150.161
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1154-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1154.164
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1126-aws - 4.4.0-1126.140
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-4.13.0-32-lowlatency - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1091-kvm - 4.4.0-1091.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1031-aws - 4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1008-oracle - 4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1060-fips - 4.4.0-1060.66
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1060-fips - 4.4.0-1060.66
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1060-fips - 4.4.0-1060.66
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1060-fips - 4.4.0-1060.66
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-208.240').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1150.161').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1154.164').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.140').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1015.15').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1091.100').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.66').
